text: Vasily Rodchev (1768–1803) was a Russian painter. The son of a carpenter, he was active primarily as a history painter, although at least one portrait by him is known. He studied at the Academy in Saint Petersburg, taking lessons from one P. Sokolov; in 1800 he received the title of Academician. In 1803, not long before his death, he was made a professor at the Academy. ==References== * Russian Portrait [sic] of the 18th and 19th century (exhibition catalog). Moscow, 1976. title: Vasily Rodchev
